author: Hadlee Simons
title: BlackBerry reveals Android phone plan
text:
BlackBerry reveals Android phone plan Article By: Hadlee Simons Tue, 29 Sep 2015 1:19 PM Share Your Email A screengrab of a video, showing BlackBerry CEO John Chen with the Priv Android smartphone. 
BlackBerry has announced a new name and a launch date for its upcoming Slider Android smartphone. 
The Slider is now called the Priv, and will be launched later this year, BlackBerry CEO John Chen said. 
"Today, I am confirming our plans to launch Priv, an Android device named after BlackBerry's heritage and core mission of protecting our customers' privacy. Priv combines the best of BlackBerry security and productivity with the expansive mobile application ecosystem available on the Android platform," Chen said during an earnings call. 
Still, the company said it wasn't leaving BlackBerry 10 in the lurch. 
"BlackBerry expects the device to be available late in the calendar year in major markets in-store and online, and will release further details in the coming weeks," the firm said. 
"While the new device will provide a choice in OS to new and existing customers, the company remains committed to the BlackBerry 10 operating system, which enables industry-leading security and productivity benefits." Read More
